title: The Developers Guide to GenAI
text:
Biggest Challenge: Specificity

    
      
        âš ï¸
      

      
        
          GenAI will fail when given tasks that are:
        
        
          
            âœ˜ Too complex without breakdown
          
          
            âœ˜ Ambiguous in requirements
          
          
            âœ“ Break down complex tasks
          
          
            âœ“ Be specific in instructions
          
        
      
    

    
      
        "The quality of your output is directly proportional to the specificity of your input."

        â€” Ilya Sutskever

title: The Developers Guide to GenAI
section: âš”ï¸ Model Tiers: Choose Your Weapon!
text:
âš”ï¸ Model Tiers: Choose Your Weapon!
Most model providers offer a range of models, often tiered by capability and cost:




ğŸ‘‘ Flagship Models

  âœ… Complex reasoning, high accuracy, creative tasks.
  âš ï¸ Slower, more expensive.

Examples: OpenAI o1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Gemini 2.5 Pro, Llama 4 Behemoth



âš–ï¸ Balanced Models

  âœ… Good balance of performance, speed, and cost for general use.
  âš ï¸ May not match flagship on the most complex tasks.

Examples: GPT-4o, Claude 3.7 Sonnet (Non reasoning)



âš¡ Fast/Lite Models

  âœ… High throughput, low latency, simple tasks, cost-sensitive applications.
  âš ï¸ Less capable reasoning, potentially lower accuracy.

Examples: GPT-4o-mini, Claude 3.5 Haiku, Gemini 2.0 Flash and Flash-lite




Key takeaway: Match the model tier to your specific needs and budget!





  ğŸ§  Claude 3.7 Sonnet
  ğŸ® Type:Reasoning & Coding
  ğŸ§© Input: Text, Image
  ğŸ–¼ Output: Text
  ğŸ“ Context: 200K tokens
  ğŸ›  Function Calling: âœ…
  ğŸ—ï¸ Structured Output: âœ…
  ğŸ¤” Reasoning: âœ…
  ğŸ’» Special Ability: Computer Use (mouse, keyboard, browser)
  
  ğŸ’ª Strengths:
  
    Amazing coder
    Caches content
    Performs autonomous computer tasks
  
  âš ï¸ Weaknesses:
  
    No image output
  



  âœ¨ Gemini 2.0 Flash
  âš¡ Type: Speed & Efficiency / Long Context
  ğŸ§© Input: Text, Image, Audio, Video, Voice
  ğŸ–¼ Output: Text, Voice
  ğŸ“ Context: 1M tokens
  ğŸ›  Function Calling: âœ…
  ğŸ—ï¸ Structured Output: âœ…
  ğŸ¤” Reasoning: âŒ
  
  ğŸ’ª Strengths:
  
    Very fast response times
    Cost-effective
    Excellent for long context tasks
    Good for high-volume/frequency tasks
  
  âš ï¸ Weaknesses:
  
    Less performant on highly complex reasoning vs Pro
  




  ğŸ§  DeepSeek-R1 (OS)
  ğŸ’¡ Type: Coding & Technical Reasoning
  ğŸ§© Input: Text, Images (VL variant)
  ğŸ–¼ Output: Text
  ğŸ“ Context: 128K tokens
  ğŸ›  Function Calling: âŒ
  ğŸ—ï¸ Structured Output: ğŸ”¶
  ğŸ¤” Reasoning:âœ…
  
  ğŸ’ª Strengths:
  
    Exceptional coding & mathematical reasoning
    Strong multilingual capabilities (Chinese+English)
    Open-source
  
  âš ï¸ Weaknesses:
  
    Fewer modalities than some competitors
    Less robust content moderation
